captions.text: (Music)

Gemma's Bigger Bolder Baking
Homemade Ice Cream Holiday Flavors

Hi Bold Bakers! Back by popular demand, is
my homemade no machine ice cream but with a twist.

I am making BIG & BOLD holiday flavors
and customizing them from some of your great
suggestions. So let's get baking!

To make my homemade no machine ice cream,
all you need is a stand mixer or a hand mixer
and just two ingredients. It is that easy.

To make your ice cream base, you're going
to whip your cream on high speed until it

reaches stiff peaks. I use heavy whipping
cream but I know it's not available everywhere

so I put other options in the description
box below.

Once your cream is whipped to stiff peaks,
this is what it should look like. Nice and

thick: this is the texture you're looking
for.

Our next ingredient is the condensed milk.
I use Fat Free because it doesn't actually

seem as sweet. Also, unfortunately there's
no substitute for the condensed milk.

The condensed milk whips better when it's
cold so I like to leave my tin in the fridge
overnight before using it.

Now you turn the machine back on high and
you're going to whip these two ingredients
together until your mixture is thick again.

Make sure you stay tuned until the very end
of this video to see all of the holiday flavors.

And there you have it, that's your ice cream
base. Now this is the texture your base should

be: really thick. This is why we whip it up
again after we add the condensed milk.

Now let's get started on our first holiday
flavor.
Oooh, yumm!

Do you want to know what to do with your leftover
holiday dessert? We're going to make it into ice cream.

We are making Pumpkin Pie Ice Cream. The pie
that I'm using is from my holiday pie video

so if you want that recipe go check out that
video.

In a large bowl, we're going to break up our
pumpkin pie slice, crust and all. I like to

leave some bits big for nice texture. And
then just add in your base. And then just
simply mix the two together.

Thanks to you guys for the great suggestion
for this flavor.

Can you believe it is this easy to make Pumpkin
Pie Ice Cream?

If you're going to the trouble to make homemade
ice cream, I think you should store it in

a really nice container. I'm going to put
a link in the description box below where
I got these guys.

Now just pour your ice cream into the container.
I topped mine off with seasonal pie crust shapes.

Your homemade ice cream would not be complete
without a personalized sticker. Because I
like my pumpkin pie a la mode.

Oh, my gosh it's so good. It's like my two
favorite things: pie and ice cream together.

Your ice cream takes around 6 hours to freeze
or preferably overnight. But I'm definitely
going to have more of this when it's frozen.

Our next flavor was suggested by Mia Lopez
via Pinterest and it is Sugar Cookie ice cream.

Now there is always an abundance of cookies
around the holidays so this is a great way
to reinvent them.

For my sugar cookies, I'm using my favorite
recipe from my Bubbly Baby Cupcake video.

For this ice cream, you want to break up your
sugar cookies. I like to crush them pretty

well but still leave some chunks in there
for good texture.

Add in your cookies to your ice cream base
and then simply mix them together. During

the holidays when you're looking at an abundance
of cookies in your house, now you know what
to do with them.

I like to add extra sprinkles into the ice
cream base because everybody loves sprinkles.

Because this is the season of giving, please
share this video with your friends and family

who love baking an don't forget to SUBSCRIBE
to my channel.

Now into the container. For added effect,
I like to add crushed cookies and sprinkles

to the top of my ice cream. I'm going to call
this one Sugar Cookie Christmas. I'm going

to put a link in the description box below
of how you can make these stickers yourself.
Now on with the lid and into the freezer.

Our next flavor is one of my favorites: Butter
Pecan.

To make this flavor you simply caramelize
pecans. In a heavy bottom pan, you're going

to add in your pecans, butter and brown sugar.
Then simmer these three ingredients together

until they start to turn a golden brown. It
takes around 4 minutes.

Then pour them onto parchment paper and let
them cool.

When your pecans are done, they're going to
look like this: beautiful caramel and nutty.
Mmmm. These are so good.

Like the other ice creams, we're going to
break this up leaving some bits fine and some
bits chunky.

Now add your pecans to your base and then
mix it all together. You cannot go wrong with
caramelized pecans.

And then into your ice cream container. And
then top it off with more caramelized pecans.

These ice creams make fantastic gifts for
the holidays. They are so creative and you
can customize them anyway you want.

So this flavor is a gift to all of my Bold
Bakers.
But we can't just stop here.

This next ice cream flavor, is the most requested
from you guys and it's mint. I'm going to

show you a really easy way how to do it and
how to use up all of your candy canes.

With my mortar and pestle, I'm going to break
up the candy canes. All the measurements for

these ice creams can be found in the description
box below the video.

Now again add your ice cream base to a large
bowl. And then add in your candy. So not everyone

is a lover of candy canes but when you try
them like this you will be. Look at that beautiful
color coming from the candy.

Now put it into your container and top it
off with more crushed candy canes. I'm calling
this one Peppermint Snow Ice Cream.

Recently I was lucky enough to attend a party
hosted by HGTV Handmade. There were other

great YouTube Channels there who made really
creative holiday gifts. I'm going to put a

link to all of the videos in the description
box below.

A lot of you have really enjoyed my Cinnamon
Rolls video and some have asked what to do

with any leftover rolls. So I would suggest
eating them. Or, make ice cream.

To make this flavor, you want to chop your
cinnamon roll nice and small. The more filling

and flavor you add to your ice cream base,
the better it scoops and the better it tastes.

If you have any leftover cream cheese topping,
that would also be really good in here. I'm
just saying.

Scoop your ice cream into your tub and then
sprinkle some lovely cinnamon roll crumbs

on top. Now you can truly have breakfast for
dessert.

It would not be the holidays without hot chocolate.
A lot of you have asked me how to make chocolate

ice cream. It is really easy and I'll show
you how.

You want to start out with good quality melted
chocolate. We are going to add the ice cream

base using a method called introducing. We're
going to add in a little ice cream base. Mix

it. And then we're going to follow with the
rest of the ice cream base. And then simply

fold it in. You want to work a little bit
fast because you don't want the chocolate
to set.

This tastes absolutely gorgeous. You guys
are going to love it!

You can't have hot chocolate without mini
marshmallows. So add in lots of those guys

in there. Drizzle melted chocolate for even
more indulgence and then just swirl it in.

Fill your tub with your hot chocolate ice
cream. Top with mini marshmallows and grated

chocolate. And then finish it off with your
label.

Once your ice cream is frozen, you can finally
dig in. I'm going to try the Peppermint Snow
flavor.

You know a scoop of this and the Frozen Hot
Chocolate would be perfect together. You guys
are going to like this!

And there you have it, that's how easy it
is to make holiday ice cream and there's a
flavor for everyone.

Spread the word about No Machine Holiday Ice
Cream by sharing this video with a friend.

Don't forget to subscribe to my channel and
I'll see you back here again next Thursday
for more Bigger Bolder Baking.

title: 6 NEW Holiday Ice Cream Flavors: Homemade Ice Cream (No Machine) - Gemma's Bigger Bolder Baking 43
